intro: Monelasmum paroissei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. Monelasmum paroissei is also known for its ability to thrive in humid environments, making it a favorite among indoor gardeners.
